EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Risk Management Plan executive summary to comply with 40 CRF ? 68.155 as amended by [61 FR 31726, June 20, 1996, as amended at 69 FR 18831, Apr. 9, 2004].

Location: Air Liquide Electronics US LP, 19 Steel Road West, Morrisville, PA 19067

THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT THE STATIONARY SOURCE:
Air Liquide Electronics U.S. LP is committed to: endorsing the principles of Safety First and Zero Accidents, operating safely and reliably in compliance with all applicable laws, performing in an environmentally responsible manner, consistently producing products and services that meet or exceed our customer?s expectations, driving continual improvement and innovation & effectively applying lessons learned.

Air Liquide is a member of the American Chemistry Council (ACC) with a commitment to meet all the code requirements of the Responsible Care Program.

The Morrisville plant complies with Air Liquide Electronics U.S. LP (ALEUS) policies on process design to reduce probability of release or accident, risk assessment for new and existing processes, incident investigation and reporting, management of change, ready for startup review, process maintenance, and training as accidental release prevention.

The Morrisville plant maintains, follows, and trains personnel on an Emergency Action Plan.

THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:
The Air Liquide Morrisville, PA plant primary activity is transfer of product from a bulk source into compressed gas cylinders. This type of activity is commonly referred to as repackaging. The covered processes at the Morrisville Plant are chlorine re-packaging, hydrogen chloride re-packaging, and silane re-packaging.

THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:
The chemical specific accidental release and accident prevention steps are those to mitigate risk from toxic and flammable gases.

This facility complies with EPA?s accident

prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. 

Air Liquide?s Morrisville location utilizes the following accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:
a) ?management of change? to ensure the covered process is not altered without a safety review
b) operation following written operating procedures
c) training in the process for all operators
d) preventative maintenance
e) pre-startup safety review
f) near miss and incident investigation with corrective and preventative actions
g) hazard review by process hazard analysis procedure
h) use of pressure vessels covered under DOT
i) area electrical classification and conforming equipment
j) hazard communication (OSHA Hazcomm)
k) safety program with monthly meetings
l) hot work program
m) safe work program

Air Liquide?s Morrisville location utilizes the following chemical specific prevention steps at the stationary source:
a) leak checking equipment prior to operation per standard operating procedure
b) scrubbers to mitigate chemical discharge
c) pressure relief devices as specified by DOT and/or ASME
d) hazardous gas monitoring and supervised alarms
e) process hazard identification by process hazard analysis
f) check valves 
g) fire detectors, sprinklers and alarms
h) operating by following written operating procedures
i) emergency action plan training
j) operating and maintenance training
k) management of change for all changes
l) lockout followed (safe work program)
m) burst disc
n) ventilation
o) preventative maintenance
p) pressure gauges
q) housekeeping
r) personnel protective equipment

THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

Air Liquide?s Morrisville location has never had an accident involving chlorine, hydrogen chloride or silane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:
The Morrisville location maintains its own team of emergency res

ponders to handle emergencies both on property as well as off property, including customer sites. The ER team utilizes a fully equipped trailer that can be sent for emergencies outside the plant. At the plant, a stand alone building has been designated as a command post center where ER equipment is stored and emergencies can be addressed. The building also contains the key contact information to communicate to outside agencies and local authorities.

The Morrisville Plant maintains an Off Site Emergency Response Plan that is approved annually by the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC). The plan details the essential actions to take should an emergency occur.

The site is a member of a nationwide Emergency Response Program with trained responders strategically positioned in all parts of the United States to respond to chemical emergencies. Air Liquide is also a member of COMPGEAP. This organization combines the response resources of many companies across the United States should a member company need a assistance in an emergency situation. 

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:
Morrisville plant plans on:
adding standard operating procedures to an electronic system for tracking revisions and operator training
enhancing alarm supervision system
enhancing documentation on mechanical integrity program
